summary: Chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear weapons have the potential to kill thousands of people in a single incident. The Department of Homeland Security merged some components that address chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear threats in 2017 to form its office of Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction. The office manages programs intended to enhance the nation's ability to detect, deter, and defend against these threats. We...
title: Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction: Opportunities for DHS to Better Address Longstanding Program Challenges
